stories.title: Ade & Feyi: The First Year Test
stories.excerpt: They loved each other deeply—but small misunderstandings kept piling up. Here’s the moment they learned repair is a skill...
stories.intro: Ade and Feyi had been married for 5 years. They loved each other—but their first year revealed patterns they didn’t know they carried.

sections.heading: What went wrong
sections.body: They assumed love would automatically produce understanding. But stress exposed their communication gaps: tone, timing, and unspoken expectations.

sections.heading: The turning point
sections.body: One night, instead of arguing to “win”, they chose to repair: “I’m not your enemy. Help me understand what hurt you.”

sections.heading: What they practiced
sections.body:
1) Soft start-up
2) Naming feelings without blame
3) Quick repair after tension
4) Weekly check-ins

stories.reflectionPrompt: Where do you tend to “win arguments” instead of building understanding?

stories.title: Kemi & Seyi: Godly Dating Without Confusion
stories.excerpt: Chemistry is real, but clarity is holy. This story shows how they set boundaries without killing the joy...
stories.intro: They liked each other. The attraction was real. But they wanted peace, clarity, and honour—without playing games.

sections.heading: They defined the relationship early
sections.body: Instead of endless “vibes”, they asked clear questions: intention, timeline, and spiritual alignment.

sections.heading: They set boundaries without punishment
sections.body: Boundaries weren’t ultimatums—they were protection. “I’m not rejecting you; I’m guarding what God is building.”

takeaways: Boundaries protect love, not kill it.
Peace is a fruit—pay attention to it.
stories.reflectionPrompt: What boundary do you need to set so your dating life stays peaceful and honourable?
